keyMoments.title: Bellemère's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Introduced through flashback as Nami and Nojiko's adoptive mother, living peacefully with them in Cocoyasi Village.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes one of the most important parental figures in Nami's life.

keyMoments.title: Bellemère's Impossible Choice
keyMoments.description: Chooses to pay tribute for her daughters rather than save herself, refusing to deny they are her family.
keyMoments.significance: Defines her character as someone who values family above life itself.
keyMoments.quote: I can't do that. I can't pretend they're not my daughters.

keyMoments.title: How Bellemère Found Nami and Nojiko
keyMoments.description: Flashback reveals she found infant Nami and young Nojiko as war orphans and adopted them despite her own injuries.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that her love for them transcends biology.
keyMoments.quote: The second I saw you two crying there, I knew. You gave me a reason to survive.

keyMoments.title: Bellemère's Death
keyMoments.description: Murdered by Arlong after paying tribute for her daughters, declaring her love with her final breath.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most emotional deaths in One Piece that defines Nami's character arc.

statusHistory.reason: Killed by Arlong for not being able to pay tribute for herself

relationships.description: Adoptive mother who found Nami as an infant and raised her with unconditional love.

evolutionMoments.description: Bellemère sacrifices her life rather than deny Nami is her daughter.

relationships.description: Adoptive mother who found Nojiko as a young child and raised her.

evolutionMoments.description: Bellemère sacrifices her life rather than deny Nojiko is her daughter.

relationships.description: Murdered by Arlong for not having enough money to pay tribute for herself.

reveals.information: Former Marine who found Nami and Nojiko as war orphans and adopted them
Values family above her own life, refuses to deny her daughters even at cost of death
Killed by Arlong for being unable to pay tribute for herself

keyMoments.title: Nami's Origin Revealed
keyMoments.description: Revealed that Nami was found as an infant orphan on a battlefield and adopted by Bellemère.
keyMoments.significance: Explains Nami's origins and her relationship with Bellemère.

keyMoments.title: Witnesses Bellemère's Death
keyMoments.description: Young Nami watches helplessly as Arlong murders her adoptive mother.
keyMoments.significance: The traumatic event that shapes Nami's entire life and motivations.

keyMoments.title: Forced to Join Arlong Pirates
keyMoments.description: Arlong forces young Nami to become his cartographer with the false promise she can buy back her village for 100 million berries.
keyMoments.significance: Begins Nami's eight-year servitude and explains her actions throughout the arc.

keyMoments.title: Nami's Savings Stolen
keyMoments.description: After eight years of collecting treasure, Nami's nearly 100 million berries are confiscated by corrupt Marine Captain Nezumi.
keyMoments.significance: The final betrayal that breaks Nami and leads to her asking Luffy for help.

relationships.description: Adoptive mother who found Nami as an infant and raised her with love.

evolutionMoments.description: Nami's backstory with Bellemère is fully revealed, along with Bellemère's sacrifice.

relationships.description: Adoptive sister, both raised by Bellemère.
The fishman who killed her mother and forced her into servitude for eight years.

evolutionMoments.description: Arlong kills Bellemère and forces young Nami to join his crew.

reveals.information: Found as an infant war orphan and adopted by Bellemère
Forced to join Arlong Pirates at age 10 after witnessing Bellemère's murder
Has been working for eight years to collect 100 million berries to buy back her village
Exceptional cartography talent recognized by Arlong

keyMoments.title: Captain Nezumi's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Corrupt Marine Captain Nezumi arrives at Cocoyasi Village to confiscate Nami's treasure on Arlong's tip.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a corrupt Marine who represents the failure of justice in East Blue.

keyMoments.title: Nezumi's Corruption Revealed
keyMoments.description: Revealed to be on Arlong's payroll, accepting bribes to ignore Arlong's crimes.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the depth of corruption preventing justice in the region.

keyMoments.title: Seizes Nami's Life Savings
keyMoments.description: Confiscates all of Nami's treasure claiming it as stolen government property, and has his men shoot Nojiko.
keyMoments.significance: The act that finally breaks Nami's spirit and forces her to seek Luffy's help.
keyMoments.quote: This money is stolen government property. We're confiscating it all.

relationships.description: Corrupt alliance where Nezumi accepts bribes from Arlong to ignore his crimes and assist him.

evolutionMoments.description: Nezumi acts on Arlong's tip to steal Nami's savings.

relationships.description: Steals Nami's life savings on Arlong's orders.

reveals.information: Corrupt Marine Captain who accepts bribes from Arlong
Captain of Marines 16th Branch in East Blue

keyMoments.title: Nojiko's Origin
keyMoments.description: Revealed that Nojiko was found as a young child orphan and adopted by Bellemère.
keyMoments.significance: Explains Nojiko's relationship with Nami and Bellemère.

keyMoments.title: Witnesses Bellemère's Death
keyMoments.description: Watches helplessly as Arlong murders her adoptive mother.
keyMoments.significance: The traumatic event that shapes Nojiko's protective nature toward Nami.

keyMoments.title: Shot Protecting Nami
keyMoments.description: Nojiko is shot by Nezumi's Marines while trying to protect Nami and her treasure.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Nojiko's willingness to sacrifice herself for her sister.

relationships.description: Adoptive mother who found Nojiko as a child and raised her.

evolutionMoments.description: Bellemère's sacrifice for Nojiko is revealed.

relationships.description: Adoptive sister, both raised by Bellemère.

reveals.information: Found as a young war orphan and adopted by Bellemère

keyMoments.title: Arlong Arrives at Cocoyasi Village
keyMoments.description: Eight years ago, Arlong and his crew arrive at the village demanding tribute.
keyMoments.significance: The arrival that dooms the village and changes Nami's life forever.
keyMoments.quote: 100,000 berries per adult, 50,000 per child. Those who cannot pay will die.

keyMoments.title: Murders Bellemère
keyMoments.description: Callously shoots and kills Bellemère for not having money to pay for herself.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Arlong's cruelty and willingness to murder innocent people.
keyMoments.quote: You don't have enough money for yourself. That means you die.

keyMoments.title: Forces Nami to Join His Crew
keyMoments.description: Recognizes young Nami's cartography talent and forces her into servitude with a false promise.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Arlong's manipulative nature and establishes Nami's eight-year imprisonment.
keyMoments.quote: Your talent for maps is extraordinary. You will draw maps for me.

relationships.description: Murdered Bellemère for not being able to pay tribute.
Forced Nami into servitude after killing her mother.
Bribes Nezumi to ignore his crimes and assist in controlling the region.

reveals.information: Arrived at Cocoyasi Village eight years ago and established his tribute system
Ruthlessly enforces tribute system, willing to murder those who cannot pay
Has corrupt Marine Captain Nezumi on his payroll

keyMoments.title: Tries to Help Bellemère
keyMoments.description: Genzo suggests Bellemère hide Nami and Nojiko to save money, but she refuses.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Genzo's role as village protector and his care for the family.

keyMoments.title: Witnesses Bellemère's Death
keyMoments.description: Genzo watches helplessly as Arlong murders Bellemère.
keyMoments.significance: Deepens Genzo's hatred of Arlong and protective feelings toward Nami.

relationships.description: Friend and fellow protector of Cocoyasi Village.
Acts as a protective father figure after Bellemère's death.

reveals.information: Village sheriff who tries to protect residents from Arlong
